availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah M. McCarty (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand, private 1st KY Cav (C.S.A.) )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William M. McCarty and Sally Mitchusson McCarty. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Princeton in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) from November 3, 1861. Prisoner of war at Louisville, Kentucky; Camp Chase, Ohio; and Rock Island Barracks, Illinois, from from September 8, 1863, to February 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 378.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 31.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell, Princeton, p. 502.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film 000851644, p. 202.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administration Bonds, Vol 19-201830-1869.
